abstract: Federal Railroad Administration reports that most freight railroads and passenger trains in United States will not be able to meet December 31 deadline for installing positive train control, technology that prevents trains from exceeding speed limits and helps avoid crashes; Congress set deadline following 2008 train derailment in California that killed 25 people; full installation is expected to be completed by 2020.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Railroad Administration said the majority of freight and passenger rail companies would not be able to install the technology known as positive train control by Dec. 31.

headline.main: Most Railroads Won’t Meet Deadline for Safety Controls, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Rails to Miss Deadline on Safety, Panels Learn

snippet: The Federal Railroad Administration said the majority of freight and passenger rail companies would not be able to install the technology known as positive train control by Dec. 31.
